MONL.content: “the loving and jealous vengeance of a new work of training [dressage], restore and reinvent language”

SPOM.content: the address “I’m going to teach you to live,” from lips of master, father to son > hesitates btwn address as experience, as education, as taming or training (dressage)

POR.content: via Aristotle, knowledge as knowing to learn and to teach
sight is privileged sense re: knowledge, knowing for sake of knowing linked to sight as senseless sensation (sight privileged even when no praxis in view)
bees, Aristotle says they can’t learn because they can’t hear
for Aristotle, theoretician leader possessing logos knows how to teach, how to lead, how to command

HERP.content: Heidegger [on Bildung]: community of struggle (Kampfgemeinschaft) a struggle that holds opposition open, permits resolute self-examination [only the “few”] [see p. 190]

HASD.content: [re: negative theology] a politics of initiation or teaching, multiplication of voices, veil dissimulates & renders attractive at same time [Augustine: God is powerful w/out power]
agogic path [askesis] of a text [Dionysus to Timothy]: repetition or repeatability

PP.content: [in your soul (en tēi psuchēi), like a mantra, an education]

seed must submit to logos, do violence to itself, since sperm is opposed to law of logos > when Plato turns live speech into psychic graphē he does so w/ a problematic of truth: l’écriture en tè psuchè n’est pas une écriture de frayage, mais seulement d’enseignement, de transmission, écriture d’aletheia
Plato uses letter, alphabet, for pedagogical ends > never thematizes law of difference made apparent, the irreducibility of structure & relation, of proportionality, w/in analogy

POOF.content: the pledge (la parole donnée) before the living dead must recall the political principle: politeía forms men, it’s not a consequence of this aristocratic equalization > politics is that which forms men, regulates itself in its laws re: nature, eugenics, education
acc. Heidegger, Christianity is an education of passions, even a psychology, a psychological subjectivity—all post-Aristotelian friendships are Christian, same goes for ‘politics’

FWT.content: training as a form of cloning

DS.content: Mallarmé’s book is a block composed of sheets of paper—its “cubic perfection” is open, impossibility of closure, dehiscence as “internal” theater, practice of spacing put in play

P.content: Hegel’s Lectures on Aesthetics: system of training for teaching and cycle of knowledge
metaphor of circle of circles, of training (Bildung) as philosophical encyclopedia

ROP.content: Freud’s link to all disciplines that question analysis: teaching, teaching philosophy, and (w/ its concern for truth & avowal) confession

OTO.content: strict adherence to classical pedagogy (whose imperatives one can never break from once and for all) would reduce you to silence, tedium, tautology

for Nietzsche, culture (Bildung) begins when we know how to treat the living as living; Derrida discusses a pact, alliance, contract, a hymen w/ living language, w/ mother (tongue), against death (father): even good master of history (science of the father) trains for the sake of mother tongue, must know when to suppress ‘historical interest’ for culture to begin
Nietzsche: rights of genius have been democratized, so everyone is relieved of the labor to form oneself
phoenix motif [in Nietzsche]: one burns what is already dead, the appearance of life, so living feminine can be reborn in these ashes [cf. EN]

Derrida compares phoenix motif to Nietzsche’s call to actively destroy/forget Zarathustra, & to training methods, a treatment of the body (via tongue, ear) > must destroy selectively, the degenerate, which offers itself to annihilation, Entartung as life principle hostile to life [cf. GM]
Nietzsche: culture (Bildung) begins w/ obedience (Gehorsamkeit), subordination (Unterordnung), discipline (Zucht), not academic freedom

the umbilicus has you by the ear, the ear is “taking notes,” the master a mouth (ear, mouth: both invaginated, involuted orifices) > the umbilical cord of State (dead father, cold monster) education, like a leash, commands us to write—that’s uncanny

no trace of woman in State education system, she is the great “cripple,” not even attached to the [State] umbilical cord > Derrida does not say this to seduce, a vulgar procedure, and a ubiquitous one, “gynegogy”
except the mother, there’s a mother in this system (faceless figure, survives on bottom)

ATIA.content: one should try not to repeat oneself, it gives appearance of training (dressage), of following a program
man names the animals to dominate, domesticate, train them
vous entraîner à ma suite “train you to follow me, drag you after me” in coordination w/ hunting him (Derrida) down through labyrinths
transgressal experience of limitrophy, trephō, trophē, trophos: to feed limit, train, nurse, make grow, thicken, fold, divide the line, multiply/increase limit’s figures [not efface the limit]

O.content: Hegel: “Bildung (culture) must leave room for the earnestness of life in its concrete richness; this leads the way to experience of the thing itself”

Gii.content: Heidegger’s question of technology presented as protest, barely disguised condemnation of professionalization of University studies during Nazi regime

PIO.content: no invention w/out advent, singular structure of event, makes come about what is new in a “first time ever,” [cf. première fois] inauguration of a possibility/power at disposal of everyone, thus conventions, belonging to a culture (heritage, pedagogical institution, discipline)
invention begins by being susceptible to repetition, exploitation, reinscription

WAP (P).content: the 3 meanings of du droit à la philosophie, the 4th: can we go right to philosophy, do we need training; adverbial “right” enriches & overdetermines other meanings [?]
is the “people” [of philosophy?] a given or a horizon of a training?
time of teaching as time of training (formation) > lodges itself in fold of already and not yet
Kant’s maxim is not the law, it is the subjective relation to the law, rule of action in conformity w/ law > teaching/training thus administered at level of maxim

drawing one’s authority from oneself, and thus from Kant; Kant’s heritage has been tattooed in, privileged inscription of an absolute privilege, quasi-naturalized right in its training, a norm, a program > Kant authorizes/authenticates dignity of “great” philosophy (even if it’s speaking against him) [to ignore Kant would be to succumb to Kant]
Kant’s discourse as a (proposed) pedagogy—professional right of philosophy: legitimacy of its objective constraint
onto-theological, phallogocentric principles of metaphysics guided by question “what is?” subordinates all fields to onto-encyclopedic instant: leads to unity of philosophical university
a university is always the construction of a philosophy
Derrida, who has to act sometimes as if his published work doesn’t exist, talks about a fictive zero point in a seminar: a repetition and a “complete beginning”
chaque pas est toujours piégé, defending philosophy, destroying philosophy, using fragmentary, aphoristic, elliptical language > each can serve most violent didacticism

WAP (TB).content: as a didactic technique, teaching becomes organon of repetition, teaching as history of the sign > teaching body lives from belief in transcendental signified, which comes back to life, more and better, w/ authority of transcendental phallus (signifier of signifiers)

toute université met le langage dans cette position de retard ou de dérivation par rapport au sens ou à la vérité > w/ signifier of signifier teaching structure (belatedness) given a second wind (souffle) >
move from learning authors to learning questions is not more liberating
Condillac’s ideological, revolutionary discourse on teaching body
paideia as auto-encyclopedia > teacher effaces himself so student can begin again [Condillac]
acc. Napoleon, teachers should be single men
maîtres-assistants contradiction or breach (brèche) in teaching body > always in places of this kind that front has best chance of establishing itself

[speaking of teaching body] hear I am, the teaching body, in what way is this a glorious body? all light on me > it is also glorious because no longer a body: sublimated, at once part/whole of general teaching body, representative of philosophical/sociopolitical corpus

teaching body fascinates when it’s more than a center: its excentricity permits synoptic surveillance covering field of (indistinguishable) body taught & permits withdrawal, reserve, of body that does not surrender, offering itself from only one side [visor effect?]
body becomes teaching and exercises mastery by a stratified erasure in front of/behind the corpus taught
moral & political system forms the object & actualized structure of pedagogy

WAP (CT).content: philosophy is ontology, its paideia an encyclopedia
philosophy always conceived w/ dialectico-pedagogical relation to “teaching”
since 19th century, structure of teaching philosophy has been nationalized
to not advance a philosophical training/teaching due to suspicion of “progressivity” gives credence to a mystifying argument (mystifying and w/out future)

WAP (AH).content: how old should a student be before they are taught philosophy?
GREPH risks primitive desire, naturalistic mystification: self-effacing teacher places truth in student, always ready (naturally) to philosophize, an invisible writing upon pupil body

most durable tradition of philosophical teaching: revelation, unveiling, discovered truth of “already there (déjà la)” acc. mode of “not-yet (pas encore),” unveiling: Socrato-Platonic anamnesis or even neo-Heideggerian philosophy of psychoanalysis [Lacan?]

childhood as pure memory, not yet speculation; young Hegel, very gifted, an example (pour example), the essence of a possibility, not exemplary (en example): all children should be able like young Hegel to play role, figure, of moment in pedagogy of the mind
the “pas-encore du déjà” of young Hegel, a stage of understanding before speculation, thus forbidding what Hegel seems to be promoting: teaching philosophy in the Gymnasium
current mode of productive spontaneity (independent, living self-discovery) & the old monotonous, mnemotechnical pedagogy both make of a child more abstract than the adult
age of formalism & quantitative technique: “incapable childhood (unvermögende Kindheit)”
[how can a pedagogical formula avoid blind spot, thus rightfully accused of babble, hollowness?]
Hegel’s pedagogy: privileging the memorization of content over form and wrest religious instruction from religion > bring it into speculative thought
Hegel, Heidegger, Nietzsche all against utilitarian pedagogy

WAP (PC).content: myth that all philosophy is impossible before “adolescence,” figure of 15-18 year old man, virgin yet fully grown: ripe for philosophy; the adult philosopher, as Callicles says in Gorgias: “unmanly & worthy of a beating”

WAP (DB).content: Derrida’s argument against too young for philosophy
Socratico-transferential: interminable training from same teacher one’s entire life

IW.content: Rosenzweig sees Cohen as a philosopher-teacher who reminds us of the abyssal risk of thought or existence
via Cohen, need for pedagogy: awaken what is asleep in logocentered psyche

+R.content: resonances leading you astray, what if I like words in order to be-tray (pour trahir) > (pour traiter, triturer, traîner, tramer, tracer, traquer)

TN.content: untouchable before vow of abstinence [cf. OG p. 109 spacing prior to prohibition of names]? a vow of abstinence requires promise of touch > touch haunting abstinence itself, intensifying transgression: unforgivable perjury at heart of interdict
touching remains limitrophe > an inhibition constitutes its appetite: it eats w/out eating what it comes to cultivate, elevate, educate, dresser (train), trephein
for de Biran, the hand is irreplaceable/dominant (teleological) and it’s pregnant w/ every kind of metonymy (pedagogical): best ontoteleological figure, best rhetorical figure
“transcendentalism” always guided by such surreptitious exemplarism
Ravaisson: good habit as return to innocence through training

AD.content: Levinas proposes a teaching via welcoming that gives/receives something else, not ruse of master who feigns effacement behind figure of midwife
maieutics, stuck in the same, teaches me nothing, only what is already in myself: même, egomet ipse, medisme, pouvoir savoir, property, gathers in itself (rassemble en lui-même) capacity & knowing
Levinas’ open door calls for the opening of an exteriority or of a transcendence of the idea of infinity > idea comes through the door: the door passed through is reason in teaching
Levinas refers to Aristotle: agent intellect discovers knowledge coming in by the door > [Levinas sees reception in this transitivity, an absolute exteriority not found in maieutics]
Levinas gives teaching magisterial height: teaching what “to welcome,” “to receive”

CIN.content: Woolf: “incarnadine the willows…for we have done with this ‘education’!”

BSi.content: “storytelling,” convention of some historical as if, fabular > a moral lesson, a political strategy, pedagogical artifice to credit a fable: to make known (political logic, rhetoric)

fabular dimension of political not just sayings or writings but actions > death & suffering inscribed in affabulatory score (on Television): put living beings on stage to accredit interpretation of narrative, to faire savoir, like Augustine’s making truth, veritatem faciare
D.H. Lawerence: “I despised myself and the voices of my accursed human education”
nomos of oikos: taming, training > oikonomia also general condition of ipseity of sovereign mastery

OG.content: Rousseau advocates a kind of natural supplement w/ culture, a suppléance, habit, pedagogy, as necessary and insufficient to reconstitute wholeness of mother nature
childhood first call for suppléance, first manifestation of deficiency, pedagogy crudely shows the paradox of supplement
slow place of pedagogy, Nature takes her time, outpaced by immediacy of dangerous supplement which burns the halting points (brûle les étapes), consumes l’énergie sans retour
(292, 292n) teach by example or explanation? but will the child do it by heart or memory? is there virtue in imitating virtue? [Kant, Rousseau]

EU.content: for Schelling, philosopher develops negative condition: consciousness of inanity of all finite knowledge > ability to translate, re-translate, the real to the ideal can be acquired—can be cultivated in a Bildung and become untransformable habitus, unalterable organ
acc. Kant, all pedagogy gives conclusions w/out principle: place of passage, access to results of a thought elaborated
relation btwn critique & metaphysics [in Kant]: socio-pedagogic scenography, also determined thinking on right to philosophy

for Kant, the 3 places of pedagogy: 1) return to principles, coming to consciousness of metaphysics 2) theoretical instruction, indicate relation btwn moral principles & anthropological consequences 3) moral education in field of moral anthropology, conditions of application
for Kant, pedagogy, discipline of philosophy, not purely philosophical

FV.content: [re: Benveniste on Aristotle’s categories (see p. 416n), Freud referring to The Emperor’s New Clothes] example of illustrative jubilation, treats element of its “scientific” discourse as marvelous paradigm there to be found, happily available (disponible) for instructing discourse
